title: [QUESTION] Struggling to Build on Windows or Mac
body:
Hi, 
I'm struggling to build Skia Sharp. I've tried following the instructions in https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/wiki/Building-SkiaSharp but I get stuck and I'm not sure what I'm missing. I'm working on Mobile Blazor Bindings which is built on Xamarin Forms so I'll only need to work with managed code.

I've included details below, I'm not sure how much of it is relevant or if I'm missing anything. Any tips would be much appreciated.

##Windows
On windows I'm running VS 2019 16.7, I've installed GTK 2.12.

When I tried to run `.\bootstrapper.ps1 -t externals-download` I initially had an error `You cannot run this script on the current system`, which I fixed by changing the Execution Policy.

After that I tried running again and it got stuck at `Running Build script...`, after about half an hour I cancelled it with `control + c`, I ran it again and it got further but get's stuck at `externals-downloaded`.

![Screen Shot 2020-08-09 at 2 55 35 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29908924/89727717-a651f900-da6a-11ea-8b35-c5a0b8b8f010.png)

When I open the source solution in VS Windows I can't build the SkiaSharp projects due to MSB3073, which is probably something to do with build order but I'm not sure where to go from there.

![Screen Shot 2020-08-09 at 6 04 24 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29908924/89727807-5aec1a80-da6b-11ea-804a-e78e5e7918c3.png)

I've tried adding a NetStandard project to the solution to add new code in, strangely enough it always succeeds building or doesn't build due to being up to date, even with blatant syntax errors.

## Mac
I've also tried on Mac and running `./bootstrapper.sh -t externals-download ` got stuck at `externals-download` which I eventually cancel with `control + c`

When I try to build a new .Net Standard library in the solution I get these errors, even before I've added any code.

```
obj/Debug/netstandard2.0/Test.Version.cs(2,50,2,52): warning CS7035: The specified version string does not conform to the recommended format - major.minor.build.revision
obj/Debug/netstandard2.0/Test.Version.cs(1,46,1,48): error CS7034: The specified version string does not conform to the required format - major[.minor[.build[.revision]]]
```
